main event: A series of UFO sightings were reported near Novorossisk, USSR in January and February 1958, involving luminous, circular objects of significant size and unusual behavior.
interesting points: The reported UFOs were circular in shape, with diameters ranging from 30 to 35 meters.
The objects were observed moving in straight lines at a constant altitude of about 500-600 meters, maintaining a constant hover for 20 minutes with no observed flight or noise.
Similar phenomena had been observed on previous occasions in the same area but were not reported.
The possibility of the observed objects being short-range missile-type operations was considered, indicating potential military involvement or experimentation in the area.
The sightings were considered urgent and discussions were held to assess potential impacts on national security and to resolve questions and doubts.
witnesses: Turkish Air Force personnel, Major Reyss, General Molorets, air force officers
